# isInFullScreenMode

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the view is in full screen mode.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isInFullScreenMode: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when the view is in full screen mode or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] when it is not.

## Drawing the View in Fullscreen Mode

- **enterFullScreenMode(_:withOptions:)**: Sets the view to full screen mode.
- **exitFullScreenMode(options:)**: Instructs the view to exit full screen mode.
- **NSView.FullScreenModeOptionKey**: These constants are keys that you can use in the options dictionary in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/enterFullScreenMode(_:withOptions:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/exitFullScreenMode(options:)].
